en: As you're drawing up plans to include in the presentation, you realize your deadlines might be a bit optimistic.

Setting these goals for yourself, personally, was fine to do at first. No one would be upset if something went awry. But perhaps you should be a bit more cautious in pitching to a third party. Then again, if you're too cautious they might worry the opportunity window will close.
You settle on the optimstic deadlines. You aren't intending to do this work by half measures.
You settle on cautious deadlines. Unexpected problems could always come up, and you'd rather risk no investor than an unhappy one who wants to pull out.
